div.p: Greetings. Your letter, reverend father, greatly cheered me, as it was full of the duty and kindness with which you have always treated me. They found me in the very midst of mourning for the death of my wife and consoled me in a wonderful way; for I easily perceived how much I am dear to you, even in your absence, as you do not cease to continually show your great regard for me and all mine. Therefore, for these benefits, to which I cannot be equal, I pray to God, the best and greatest, that He may repay you with strength according to His inexhaustible kindness. I am returning all those things which you recently sent to me, and I hastened as much as I could to complete them as quickly as possible. For after my wife of blessed memory passed away, I had somewhat more leisure and fewer cares; then also the subject matter itself continually attracted me, so that I could not remove my hand until I had completed the whole; many things came back to my memory, which...
